Name: Unarmed
Description: To go into a battle unarmed is either bravely or lunacy. As it is extremely difficult to block other weapons with one body without receiving damage, unarmed usually has extremely low defense unless masterly trained. Nevertheless unarmed class has sufficiently higher speed and melee attack than other melee class. Their attack also consume less stamina.

Name: Sword
Description: Sword is the most balanced weapon one can have. Simple to use but still difficult to master. It is also good for both offense and defense. The only weakness is that it has somewhat lower armour penetration capability than mace and hammer. It is worth mentioning that historically sword is somewhat expensive and rare weapon that mostly used by the rich or professional army. But it is still possible for lowly commoner to possess low quality or salvaged sword.

Name: Greatsword
Description: With the length almost as long as the height of a fully grown man, a greatsword is a weapon of cultural importance to medieval warfare history in various region of the world. From a claymore wielding Scottish Highlander to an Odachi wielding Samurai, only the best-trained warrior can fight valiantly with a greatsword in his hands.

Name: Shortsword
Description: A simple weapon used throughout the history of mankind. Most effective in an organised infantry tight formation due to its short length. The most remarkable example is Roman Legionaries who use a gladius shortsword and a Scutum tower shield with tremendous effect.

Name: Dagger
Description: Dagger is the smallest melee weapon of medieval warfare. Easy to carry and easy to use, it is often carried by light infantry as a secondary weapon.

Name: Spear
Description: Spear is the most simple weapon to use. Simply thrusting it in the right direction can kill an enemy. Due to its long range, this make spear a good counter against cavalry class but usually have somewhat lower melee defense than other melee class.

Name: Club
Description: A shabby club that is not suitable for professional warfare. Easy to obtain but also easy to break. Do not expect an extraordinary performance with this weapon.

Name: Mace
Description: Mace is a bludgeon type weapon that become popular due to the advancement of heavy armour that make bladed weaponry less effective. Some type of mace also have piercing or bladed compartments attached such as morning star or winged mace.

Name: Flail
Description: Flail is a mace with its head part attaching to chain. Although more difficult to use than mace, flail attack can be somewhat hard to predict and defend against. Its flexible swing means that the flail's head can land impact behind enemy's shield as well.

Name: Hammer
Description: Hammer is a tool of blacksmith to shape up metal. Similar to mace, hammer is also good against armoured target where its impactful strikes can leave the unfortunate receiver with broken bones or concussion if aims for the head.

Name: Handaxe
Description: A tree cutting tool converted into weapon of war. Axe is simple enough to use effectively after some practices. The weight distribution design allow the momentum of axe swing to be powerful enough to break wooden shield or even metal one.

Name: Greataxe
Description: The might of a warrior can be symbolised by only this mightiest weapon. A greataxe requires a magnificent amount of strength just to pick it up. No mere man would be mad enough to wield it into battle, for only a few swings can tire him out for the whole day.

Name: Halberd
Description: Halberd is a combination of pole arm and axe.

Name: Pike
Description: Pike is the most simple answer to the domination of cavalry. Why go attack them when you can let them come die at your weapon tip with their own speed. Due to its extremely long rang, pike user become vulnerable against melee attack and also range attack due to the lack of shield and closed stationary formation.

Name: Glaive
Description: A more of romantic and elitist weapon than a weapon of war due to the high cost of production. A glaive is often seen holding by a skilled warrior or general more often than a common soldier. It is still a fearsome weapon that can cleave through a person body with ease.

Name: Whip
Description: Not exactly a weapon for combat but rather a tool of command or sometimes duel. A sound of whip cracking can instil obedience to most slaves that they will even die for their masters if commanded.

Name: Sling
Description: Sling weapon is highly mobile and versatile enough that it can be classified as both skirmish and range. Its reload speed and ammunition are extremely high while also have decent armour penetration. It has lower damage than other range class though, so makeup for this by attacking the enemy from behind or something.

Name: Blowgun
Description: A somewhat primitive weapon that seen its use in combat mainly in tribal and Native American warfare. Mostly effective against lightly armoured troops because of its low penetration power, a blowgun is still extremely light to carry around and very easy to use. The darts are typically coated with deadly poison to incapacitate a foe even if the projectile only graze the body.

Name: Longbow
Description: Longbow

Name: Shortbow
Description: Bow is one of the most versatile range weapon available. The unit can switch between different arrow type to inflict the most effective result or status. Although, bow is not a weapon that is easy to use and even harder to master, this make bow unit somewhat more expensive than sling and crossbow unit. Shortbow is a variant of bow that is specialised for swift shooting but with somewhat lacking in range and firepower.

Name: Greatbow
Description: Sometimes bigger does not always mean better. A greatbow is almost impossible to wield, let alone shoot an enormous arrow from it. An arrow from a greatbow can penetrate a body of a man without armour easily and may even penetrate a simple wooden shield.

Name: Light Crossbow
Description: The pinnacle of warfare. Easier to use than bow that any peasant can use after few days of training to kill a knight that train for their whole life. Crossbow weapon has extremely high armour penetration than other range class but much slower reload and it is relatively useless in melee combat so use it wisely. Light crossbow is much easier to reload and carry making it more suitable for skirmish tactic and medium armour targets.

Name: Heavy Crossbow
Description: Heavy crossbow can be regarded as the first-ever weapon that can effectively kill a knight. At short range, it can penetrate chainmail easily and may even injure a knight in his plate mail. Its large size makes it cumbersome to carry around and reload though.

Name: Repeater Crossbow
Description: The first automatic hand-held weapon in the history of warfare. Ineffective at long range but devastating at short range, especially against lightly armoured troops. A repeating crossbow is often seen as an unconventional weapon that never seen use outside of Ancient China, but truly an ingenious piece of engineering nevertheless.

Name: Stone
Description: Nothing more simple than stick and stone to break some bones. Existed since the dawn of time as preferred range weapon, throwing stone can hurt someone without armor or even kill them instantly if hit in the head with strong enough force.
